name: Courtyard by Marriott Portland Hillsboro

reviews.text: I stayed here twice in August. First, with friends -- we had three rooms for two nights -- for a tennis competition. My second trip was with my teenage daughter, for a shopping trip. Both times, my stay was exceptional. The hotel was quiet and very comfortable. I love the new remodel. I reserved the rooms with Priceline "Name Your Own Price" and the room price was a great value.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay When in Beaverton

reviews.text: First time here, and like a few recent TA posts said, this place was re-done, from the ground up. The property itself may be older, but you can tell that they replaced everything inside from the carpet to the paint to the furniture.
reviews.title: Completely renovated, Rooms felt brand new

reviews.text: Everything was brand spanking new and extremely clean. If you are coming to Hillsboro for business, or a specific reason, then you will love the location too. Conveniently located right off of Sunset Highway next to nice shopping malls, eateries, and a nice movie theater. If you are not coming to stay specifically in Hillsboro, but rather just "visiting Portland", then you may not be as pleased with this location, as it is definitely not near downtown...not too bad of a drive away, but still, no where close to the city center.
reviews.title: Just renewed!

reviews.text: That's pretty much it...new, clean rooms, in a nice Portland suburb...and with the Priceline price we paid, it made this hotel even better.
reviews.title: renovated reception, new restaurant.

reviews.text: I've stayed in this hotel before a couple of times (maybe 4 or 5 times). In 2010 it has been completely renewed, including rooms - looks and feels much better than it was before. I would say it is almost ideal - good rooms, friendly staff, however two things disappointed me: now you have to order a breakfast instead of having a buffet - and this takes time, especially in the morning rush hour when hotel is completely booked and a lot of people come on business to a specific hour. The good thing with it - now there is a lobby bar that works in the evening. Same concern relates to the internet connection - it is free, but when there are a lot of people using it, it turns out to be really slow, Skype can hardly work. With that said, I still was more than satisfied.
reviews.title: Typical Marriott, Slow Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one weekend night and was totally wowed by the total renovation from last year. Prior to this stay, I was here more than a decade ago, when it was a generic, but good, Courtyard property. Now, I would rate it in the top 1% of all Courtyards in the country.
reviews.title: Superb, Top-Notch hotel in Tansabourne

reviews.text: Typically average Courtyard Hotel, stuck in the middle of nowhere. Good if you have a car but you're in trouble if you haven't. No bar or restaurant on site, other than breakfast.
reviews.title: Functional Hotel but lacking social amenities

reviews.text: Rooms ok but no more than that. Staff try to be friendly in what can only be a pretty boring location. Would only stay there again if I have to. Otherwise would stay elsewhere, make sure I have a car and be willing to travel a little.
reviews.title: Its my Home away from Home

reviews.text: Having travelled there in about 4 times in a year, the staff remembered my likings, my preferences and knows when I usually ask for shuttle and not. Very personal and friendly front desk - its my home away from home!
reviews.title: Not as bad as I thought ...
